description: From French éréthisme, from Ancient Greek ἐρεθισμός (erethismós), from ἐρεθίζειν (erethízein, “to irritate”).

entries.meaning: (pathology) Abnormal excitement of a bodily organ or tissue.

examples: Since the eighteenth century, sex has not ceased to provoke a kind of generalized discursive erethism.

entries.meaning: A neurological disorder arising from mercury poisoning, leading to irritability, depression, etc.
examples: Synonyms: erethism mercurialis, mad hatter disease, mad hatter syndrome
